property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: President Jimmy Carter arriving in Poland, 1977

note.text: Interpreters play a very important role in conversation.

In 1977, U.S. President Jimmy Carter made a diplomatic visit to Poland. Carter said he was glad to be in Poland, and his interpreter said that he was happy to have abandoned America. Carter later made a comment about his interest in the Poles' desires for the future, which was interpreted as a comment about Carter's desire for the Poles.
As you can see, misinterpretation can be highly problematic.
